visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Monthly Sales Data', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for all labels and titles, with a font size of 14px for axis labels and 16px for the title, Data series: One series named 'Sales' with data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4], Custom colors: Use a blue color (#4F81BD) for the columns, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to light gray (#F0F0F0), add a legend with the position set to bottom, and ensure the export button text is 'Export'.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with specific styling and data. The chart type is set to 'column', and the title is 'Monthly Sales Data' with a font size of 16px and a dark gray color. The x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with a font size of 14px and the same dark gray color. The data series is named 'Sales' and includes monthly sales data for a year, with columns colored in blue (#4F81BD). The chart background is set to light gray (#F0F0F0), and a legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart. Additionally, the export button is customized to display 'Export' as its text.
